result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable costs and surcharges  of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercvept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No physical punishment towards any children.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management counseling.
Complete a parent or teens class.
Successfully complete any other  counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry Barnes in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days concurrent with Count 1 in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent if needed.      
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parent of teens class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-No physical punishment towards any children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

received and filed.  rmm

COUNT 1:  Battery , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
.
COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Terry Barnes in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Abbey Marie DeSiato for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing Hearing. Branch 23 is in trial with Attorney Lipscomb on an unrelated matter. Court unable to hear matter today. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry Barnes in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAMMY R.; ERIC B.; TJB (5/10/99).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terry Barnes in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Terry Barnes in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
